Installing pygmdata¶

Requirements¶

This library only supports Python 3.6+. Usage with any other version is not supported and if it works, it is purely by accident.

Installing pygmdata¶

Installing the pygmdata library is extremely easy. The package is in PyPy and can be installed with

pip install pygmdata

Verify Installation¶

The installation can be verified by making sure that your instance of Grey Matter Data is running. Then running Python and hitting the self endpoint with the get_self() method:

>> from pygmdata import Data
>> d = pygmdata.Data("http://localhost:8181", USER_DN='CN=dave.borncamp,OU=Engineering,O=Untrusted Example,L=Baltimore,ST=MD,C=US')
>> d.get_self()
'{"label":"CN=dave.borncamp,OU=Engineering,O=Untrusted Example,L=Baltimore,ST=MD,C=US","exp":1608285907,"iss":"greymatter.io","values":{"email":["dave.borncamp@greymatter.io"],"org":["greymatter.io"]}}'

After that, you’re all installed

pygmdata
